newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: UBS sees 1996 provisions at 1.4 bln Sfr.
newsitem.headline: UBS sees 1996 provisions at 1.4 bln Sfr.

text.p: Union Bank of Switzerland (UBS) said it expected to set provisions for 1996 at 1.4 billion Swiss francs.

"On the basis of the valuation method used for credit positions up to now, we expect credit risk provisions to amount to some 1.4 billion Swiss francs for 1996," UBS said in an announcement of a domestic restructuring.

It already said that a review of its entire domestic loan portfolio produced "additional potential losses totalling 3.0 billion Swiss francs" which it said would likely be incurred over the next two to three years, if the current valuation method was applied.
